title: Ticket #1938: Run blahp over ssh on remote pbs/lsf machine
description:
Currently, for Condor to submit jobs to a PBS or LSF cluster, a schedd must be running on the frontend node of the cluster. We would like to remove that requirement and allow job submission to a PBS/LSF cluster with no prior software installation on the frontend node and only SSH access. Ideally, a user's local schedd would be able to submit jobs to multiple remote clusters via SSH.

As a first step, we will demonstrate the ability to submit jobs when the blahp is preinstalled on the frontend node and all job files remain on the frontend node. The gridmanager will start and communicate with the blahp remotely via ssh.

Summary

We have been working on a job universe type in Condor-G that allows a user to submit a job destined to run on a remote PBS or LSF cluster in which the head node of the remote cluster does not have any grid gateway software installed (such as Condor-C, Globus, Cream, etc). Instead, all that is required is for the user to have ssh access into the head node.

On the Condor-G submit side, the user needs to enumerate all the cluster front ends in which he/she has ssh access, where the blahp is installed on each, and an ssh key file and passphrase to authenticate with each.

On each cluster frontend, the blahp must be installed. At this point, we don't do any file transfer, so all job executables and data files must be installed on each cluster frontend as well. Job output files will be left on the cluster frontend.

The user can then submit their jobs to Condor-G as a standard LSF/PBS grid universe job. New parameters in the submit file specify which cluster frontend to use and where the job's files are located on the remote machine.

Aside from file transfer, all Condor-G functionality should work as normal. We plan to add file tranasfer in the future if demand warrants.

Milestones

  • Setup a local PBS cluster for testing. [DONE]
  • Submit a job by running the blahp remotely via ssh with no file transfer and hacky handling of ssh credentials. [DONE]
  • Allow disabling of all file existence and permission checks in condor_submit.
  • Determine best handling of ssh credentials. [DONE]
  • Test submitting many jobs. [DONE]
  • Test failure recovery. [DONE]
  • Setup test installation useable by Josh. [DONE]
  • Plan how to handle file transfers. (#2386)
  • Figure out how to determine whether jobs are progressing through batch queue (Marco)

Ideas for future work
